title: Readme Templates - Frontend
description: This repository provides a series of README templates to help developers document their projects üöÄüë©‚Äçüíª

functions.name: Header
functions.description: This function creates a project header with the project title.

variables.label: Project Description
variables.name: 2eafa25410274db9a7062cf16cad9aa2
variables.defaultValue: Simple description of what your project do or how to use it

functions.name: Layout
functions.description: This function creates a layout for the README file.

functions.name: Technologies
functions.description: This function lists the technologies used in the project.

variables.label: Technology Description
variables.name: a88160e9621644c588ebd10e1b9e676c
variables.defaultValue:
- list of all technologies you used
- react
- styled components
- another example

functions.name: Getting Started
functions.description: This function provides a guide on how to get started with the project.

variables.label: Getting Started Description
variables.name: a3166d322b654e32aac63cb6158f54d4
variables.defaultValue: Here you describe how to run your project locally

functions.name: Prerequisites
functions.description: This function provides a guide on the prerequisites for the project.

variables.label: Prerequisites Description
variables.name: 1ff03088c92141d98c17cd0fbe261d9d
variables.defaultValue:
Here you list all prerequisites necessary for running your project. For example:

- [NodeJS](https://github.com/)
- [Git 2](https://github.com)

functions.name: Cloning
functions.description: This function provides a guide on how to clone the project.

variables.label: Cloning Description
variables.name: dc2d2d0a27744e40bf9e9292d1ed5c26
variables.defaultValue:
How to clone your project

```bash
git clone your-project-url-in-github
```

functions.name: Starting
functions.description: This function provides a guide on how to start the project.

variables.label: Starting Description
variables.name: bae393463f694a92a3e0c400fdb3dfc9
variables.defaultValue:
How to start your project

```bash
cd project-name
npm some-command-to-run
```

functions.name: Collaborators
functions.description: This function lists the collaborators of the project.

variables.label: Collaborators Description
variables.name: a0969c002e844e33936312cc553565f3
variables.defaultValue: Special thank you for all people that contributed for this project.

functions.name: Contribute
functions.description: This function provides a guide on how to contribute to the project.

variables.label: Contribute Description
variables.name: 3e203b571fc14424a69497ed31fa43d2
variables.defaultValue:
Here you will explain how other developers can contribute to your project. For example, explaining how can create their branches, which patterns to follow and how to open an pull request

1. `git clone https://github.com/Fernanda-Kipper/text-editor.git`
2. `git checkout -b feature/NAME`
3. Follow commit patterns
4. Open a Pull Request explaining the problem solved or feature made, if exists, append screenshot of visual modifications and wait for the review!

functions.name: Documentation That Might Help
functions.description: This function provides a list of documentation that might help the user.

variables.label: Documentation Description
variables.name: 7f491f8d008d40d3a89b428f7c3c9897
variables.defaultValue:
[üìù How to create a Pull Request](https://www.atlassian.com/br/git/tutorials/making-a-pull-request)

[üíæ Commit pattern](https://gist.github.com/joshbuchea/6f47e86d2510bce28f8e7f42ae84c716)
